title: Ex EastEnders star Dean Gaffney shares sad death news in social media post
text:
Former EastEnders star Dean Gaffney, best known for his role as hapless Robbie Jackson in the soap, has shared a touching post on Instagram, paying tribute to his grandmother Nancy who has died. In the moving message, he promised his late nan that he would look after his mum.

EastEnders coilleagues such as Max Bowden and Emma Barton – as well as Dean’s fans – have been sharing messages of love and support. Along with a picture of Nanny Nancy, Dean wrote: ‘Normally I wouldn’t divulge information like this on social media, however we celebrate births and marriages but never talk about death. RIP nanny Nancy.. I promise you I will look after mum, love you with all my heart, RIP’ (sic).

The actor was recently confirmed to have been written out of the soap, with a source citing ‘a string of bad personal decisions’ as the reason. Dean has recently been sharing his journey in a wellness retreat to help his mental health.

Speaking from the centre in Spain, 41-year-old Dean explained: ‘I’m not that guy who goes to the gym all the time so I had to find another way of giving myself a goal, and this retreat was what I like to call “a step in the right direction”.

‘My health is important. I need to always be aware of that, not just physically but mentally.’

Dean’s final EastEnders scenes have already been aired in the show as Robbie was seen receiving the news that his son Sami had been injured so he was forced to rush abroad to visit him. It was after these scenes were on screen that it was confirmed Dean’s contract was not being renewed and he wouldn’t be making further appearances during this stint.

However, given that Robbie hasn’t been killed off, the door seems to have been left open for the future.
